intro: Pedicularis lasiostachys, commonly known as the hairy-stalked lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes numerous parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine, hairy structures. Pedicularis lasiostachys is typically found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
